head.title: Selfish Drivers: There Ought to Be a Law

hedline.hl1: Selfish Drivers: There Ought to Be a Law

abstract.p: Letter by Jan C Lundberg of Sustainable Energy Institute urges public to think about dwindling oil supplies and global warming

block.p: One hopes that your April 2 news article about the decrease in miles driven gets people thinking about dwindling oil supplies and global warming. Also, our health suffers from car dependence because of sedentary living, while time for work and play is lost to traffic. Society is not yet getting people out of cars, but Earth is running out of oil.

One hopes that your April 2 news article about the decrease in miles driven gets people thinking about dwindling oil supplies and global warming. Also, our health suffers from car dependence because of sedentary living, while time for work and play is lost to traffic. Society is not yet getting people out of cars, but Earth is running out of oil.

One problem with electric cars is that non-oil propulsion eliminates less than half the air pollution associated with cars, when we consider mining and manufacturing for cars. Carbon dioxide would not be lessened if cars got their propulsion from today's power grid. Solar power cannot supply tires, asphalt and plastics, as oil does. Cheap oil once brought a high energy return from extraction efforts, while most renewable fuel uses much more energy to generate any energy.
JAN C. LUNDBERG President Sustainable Energy Institute Arcata, Calif., April 3, 2001
